name: Tamagotchi
description: A handheld digital pet created in Japan by Bandai in 1996, one of the biggest toy fads of the late 1990s.

name: Beanie Babies
description: A line of stuffed toys created by Ty Warner in 1993, notable for being a major collectible craze of the 1990s.

name: Furby
description: An electronic robotic toy released in 1998 by Tiger Electronics that became a must-have toy and cultural phenomenon.

name: Pogs
description: A game that was popular among children during the mid-1990s, played with small discs originally used as milk bottle caps.

name: Super Soaker
description: A brand of recreational water gun that uses manually pressurized air to shoot water, first released in 1990 by Larami.

name: Bratz Dolls
description: A line of fashion dolls manufactured by MGA Entertainment that gained popularity in the early 2000s as an alternative to Barbie.

name: Beyblades
description: A line of spinning top toys that originated in Japan and became popular worldwide in the early 2000s.

name: Razor Scooter
description: A compact folding kick scooter developed by Micro Mobility Systems and manufactured by JD Corporation, which became a global phenomenon in the early 2000s.

name: Yu-Gi-Oh! Trading Cards
description: A Japanese collectible card game based on the fictional game of Duel Monsters from the manga and anime franchise, which became popular worldwide in the early 2000s.

name: Tickle Me Elmo
description: A stuffed Elmo toy that laughs when tickled, which became a major fad during the 1996 Christmas season.
